title: 107_s1810
content: The Act titled "Home and Farm Wind Energy Systems Act of 2001" provides a credit for wind energy property installed in residences and businesses under section 30B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Home and Farm Wind Energy Systems Act of 2001" offers a tax credit for qualified wind energy property installed in residences and businesses. The credit is equal to 30 percent (10 percent after December 31, 2011) of the amount paid for the property, with a requirement that at least 50 percent of the energy produced annually must be consumed on-site. Qualified wind energy property includes qualifying wind turbines installed in connection with a dwelling unit owned and used as the taxpayer's principal residence in the United States. The tax credit for qualified wind energy property applies to qualifying wind turbines of 75 kilowatts or less, meeting specific performance standards, installed in the taxpayer's principal residence. The tax credit for qualified wind energy property has limitations based on the amount of tax. The credit for any taxable year cannot exceed the regular tax liability plus the tax imposed by section 55, minus the sum of other allowable credits. Any excess credit can be carried over to the following taxable year. The tax credit for qualified wind energy property is subject to limitations based on the amount of tax. The credit cannot exceed the regular tax liability plus the tax imposed by section 55, minus other allowable credits. Excess credit can be carried over to the following taxable year. Special rules apply for tenant-stockholders in cooperative housing corporations and individuals who are members of condominium management associations. For qualified wind energy property, individuals in condominium management associations can claim a credit for their share of expenditures. The basis of the property is adjusted if a credit is allowed. The credit allowed under section 30B applies to property placed in service after December 31, 2001. The basis of a residence or property is reduced by the amount of the credit allowed. Section 1016 of the tax code is amended to include adjustments to basis for properties with a credit under section 30B. The tax code is amended to include a new item after section 30A, related to the credit allowed for property placed in service after December 31, 2001. The tax code amendment includes a new section, "Sec. 30B. Wind energy property," with amendments effective for property placed in service after December 31, 2001.
